metadata.title: Choosing the Best Database for Embedded Systems
metadata.description: Explore the best database options for embedded systems, comparing SQLite, Berkeley DB, Firebird, and Raima DBM for performance, features, and use cases.

prompts.PLACEHOLDER-1: A clean, modern decision tree flowchart. The start node should be "Start: Embedded Database Needs?". Branches should include "Relational SQL required?", "High concurrency/write performance?", "Key-Value or custom data structures?", "Commercial support/advanced features?", and "Specialized embedded DB?". End nodes should clearly state "Consider SQLite", "Consider Berkeley DB", "Consider RDM", "Consider Firebird". Use distinct colors for different types of nodes (e.g., blue for decisions, green for recommendations). The overall style should be professional and easy to follow.
